00013 /*
00014  * Covariance Filter Scheme.
00015  *  Implemention of extended Kalman filter
00016  * 
00017  * To work with with Linear and Linrz models
00018  *  a) a state seperate from covariance predict is used.
00019  *  b) a EKF innovation update algorithm is used.
00020  * Discontinous observe models require that predict is normailised with
00021  * respect to the observation.
00022  *
00023  * A initial observation size may also be specified for efficiency.
00024  * 
00025  * The filter is operated by performing a
00026  * predict, observe
00027  * cycle defined by the base class
00028  */
00029 #include "bayesFlt.hpp"
00030 
00031 /* Filter namespace */
00032 namespace Bayesian_filter
00033 {
00034 
00035 class Covariance_scheme : public Extended_kalman_filter
00036 {
00037 public:
00038     Covariance_scheme (std::size_t x_size, std::size_t z_initialsize = 0);
00039     Covariance_scheme& operator= (const Covariance_scheme&);
00040     // Optimise copy assignment to only copy filter state
00041 
00042     void init ();
00043     void update ();
00044 
00045     Float predict (Linrz_predict_model& f);
00046     // Standard Linrz prediction
00047     Float predict (Gaussian_predict_model& f);
00048     // Specialised 'stationary' prediction, only addative noise
00049 
00050     Float observe_innovation (Linrz_uncorrelated_observe_model& h, const FM::Vec& s);
00051     Float observe_innovation (Linrz_correlated_observe_model& h, const FM::Vec& s);
00052 
00053 public:                     // Exposed Numerical Results
00054     FM::SymMatrix S, SI;        // Innovation Covariance and Inverse
00055     FM::Matrix W;               // Kalman Gain
00056 
00057 protected:                  // Permenantly allocated temps
00058     FM::RowMatrix tempX;
00059 protected:                  // allow fast operation if z_size remains constant
00060     std::size_t last_z_size;
00061     void observe_size (std::size_t z_size);
00062 };
00063 
00064 
00065 }//namespace
00066 #endif
